canonical_explanation.text: We read time using clocks. An analog clock has two hands: the short hand shows hours, and the long hand shows minutes. There are 12 hours on a clock face and 60 minutes in 1 hour. We use AM for morning (midnight to noon) and PM for afternoon/evening (noon to midnight). 1 day = 24 hours. There are 7 days in a week and 12 months in a year. A calendar helps us find dates and days.
rules: Short hand = hour hand, Long hand = minute hand
AM = midnight (12:00) to noon (11:59), PM = noon (12:00) to midnight (11:59)
7 days in a week, 12 months in a year
30 days: April, June, September, November; 31 days: Jan, Mar, May, Jul, Aug, Oct, Dec; Feb: 28 or 29

questions.question_text: Which hand on a clock shows the hours?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand (hour hand) shows the hours. The long hand shows the minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: On a clock, the short hand points to the hour and the long hand points to the minutes.

questions.question_text: How many minutes are there in 1 hour?
questions.explanation_correct: 1 hour = 60 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: There are 60 minutes in 1 hour.

questions.question_text: If the short hand points to 3 and the long hand points to 12, what time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Short hand at 3, long hand at 12 means 3 o'clock (3:00).
questions.explanation_incorrect: When the long hand is at 12, it means 0 minutes (o'clock). The short hand at 3 = 3:00.

questions.question_text: Is 8:00 in the morning AM or PM?
questions.explanation_correct: 8:00 in the morning is 8:00 AM. AM is used for times from midnight to noon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Morning times are AM. 8:00 in the morning = 8:00 AM.

questions.question_text: Is 7:00 in the evening AM or PM?
questions.explanation_correct: 7:00 in the evening is 7:00 PM. PM is used for times from noon to midnight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Evening times are PM. 7:00 in the evening = 7:00 PM.

questions.question_text: How many days are there in a week?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 7 days in a week: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A week has 7 days: Sun, Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat.

questions.question_text: How many months are there in a year?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 12 months in a year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A year has 12 months: January through December.

questions.question_text: When the long hand points to 6, how many minutes have passed?
questions.explanation_correct: The long hand at 6 means 30 minutes (half past). Each number on the clock represents 5 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each number on the clock = 5 minutes. 6 x 5 = 30 minutes (half past the hour).

questions.question_text: What time does the clock show when the short hand is between 4 and 5, and the long hand points to 3?
questions.explanation_correct: Short hand between 4 and 5 means the hour is 4. Long hand at 3 = 15 minutes. Time = 4:15.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The hour is 4 (short hand between 4 and 5). The minutes = 3 x 5 = 15. Time = 4:15.

questions.question_text: What time is quarter past 7?
questions.explanation_correct: Quarter past means 15 minutes after. Quarter past 7 = 7:15.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A quarter of an hour = 15 minutes. Quarter past 7 = 7:15.

questions.question_text: What time is half past 10?
questions.explanation_correct: Half past means 30 minutes after. Half past 10 = 10:30.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Half past = 30 minutes. Half past 10 = 10:30.

questions.question_text: Rani goes to school at 7:30 AM. Is it morning or evening?
questions.explanation_correct: 7:30 AM is in the morning. AM times before 12:00 noon are morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AM means before noon. 7:30 AM is morning time.

questions.question_text: Which month comes right after March?
questions.explanation_correct: April comes right after March in the calendar.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is: January, February, March, April. So April follows March.

questions.question_text: How many days are there in the month of February in a non-leap year?
questions.explanation_correct: February has 28 days in a regular (non-leap) year and 29 days in a leap year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: February normally has 28 days. In a leap year (every 4 years), it has 29 days.

questions.question_text: Rohan starts homework at 4:00 PM and finishes at 5:00 PM. How long did he study?
questions.explanation_correct: From 4:00 PM to 5:00 PM is 1 hour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 5:00 - 4:00 = 1 hour of study time.

questions.question_text: A TV show starts at 6:30 PM and lasts 30 minutes. What time does it end?
questions.explanation_correct: 6:30 PM + 30 minutes = 7:00 PM.

questions.question_text: What time is quarter to 9?
questions.explanation_correct: Quarter to 9 means 15 minutes before 9 o'clock = 8:45.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 'Quarter to' means 15 minutes before the hour. Quarter to 9 = 8:45.

questions.question_text: Which day comes after Thursday?
questions.explanation_correct: Friday comes after Thursday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is: ...Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday... So Friday follows Thursday.

questions.question_text: The long hand of a clock points to 9. How many minutes past the hour is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Each number = 5 minutes. 9 x 5 = 45 minutes past the hour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Multiply the number by 5: 9 x 5 = 45 minutes.

questions.question_text: Meera left home at 8:15 AM and reached school at 8:45 AM. How long did it take her?
questions.explanation_correct: From 8:15 to 8:45 = 30 minutes.

questions.question_text: Which months have 31 days?

options.text: January, March, May, July, August, October, December

questions.explanation_correct: January, March, May, July, August, October, and December have 31 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 7 months have 31 days: Jan, Mar, May, Jul, Aug, Oct, Dec. April, June, Sep, Nov have 30. Feb has 28/29.

questions.question_text: True or False: 12:00 noon is 12:00 AM.
questions.explanation_correct: False. 12:00 noon is 12:00 PM. 12:00 AM is midnight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 12:00 noon = 12:00 PM. 12:00 AM = midnight.

questions.question_text: A train leaves at 9:30 AM and reaches at 11:00 AM. How long is the journey?
questions.explanation_correct: From 9:30 to 11:00: 9:30 to 10:00 = 30 min, 10:00 to 11:00 = 1 hour. Total = 1 hour 30 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 9:30 to 10:00 = 30 min. 10:00 to 11:00 = 60 min. Total = 90 min = 1 hour 30 minutes.

questions.question_text: How many hours are there in one full day?
questions.explanation_correct: 1 day = 24 hours (12 hours AM + 12 hours PM).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A full day has 24 hours: 12 hours from midnight to noon, and 12 hours from noon to midnight.

questions.question_text: If today is Wednesday, what day will it be after 3 days?
questions.explanation_correct: Wednesday + 1 = Thursday, + 2 = Friday, + 3 = Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count 3 days from Wednesday: Thu, Fri, Sat. After 3 days it will be Saturday.

questions.question_text: When both hands of a clock point to 12, the time is ___
questions.explanation_correct: When both hands point to 12, it is 12:00 (either noon or midnight).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both hands at 12 means 12 o'clock (12:00).

questions.question_text: Dinner is usually at 8:00 PM. Is this day or night?
questions.explanation_correct: 8:00 PM is in the evening/night. PM times after 6-7 PM are typically evening/night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8:00 PM is evening time. PM means after noon, and 8 PM is well into the evening.

questions.question_text: What is the first month of the year?
questions.explanation_correct: January is the first month of the year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The year starts with January (month 1) and ends with December (month 12).

questions.question_text: School starts at 8:00 AM and the first period ends at 8:40 AM. How long is the first period?
questions.explanation_correct: From 8:00 to 8:40 = 40 minutes.

questions.question_text: The long hand is at 4 and the short hand is between 7 and 8. What time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Short hand between 7 and 8 = 7 hours. Long hand at 4 = 4 x 5 = 20 minutes. Time = 7:20.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hour = 7 (short hand between 7 and 8). Minutes = 4 x 5 = 20. Time = 7:20.

questions.question_text: True or False: April has 30 days.
questions.explanation_correct: True. April is one of the months with 30 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: April has 30 days. The rhyme says: 'Thirty days has September, April, June, and November.'

questions.question_text: Priya sleeps at 9:00 PM and wakes up at 6:00 AM. How many hours does she sleep?
questions.explanation_correct: From 9:00 PM to 6:00 AM: 9 PM to midnight = 3 hours, midnight to 6 AM = 6 hours. Total = 9 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 9 PM to midnight = 3 hours. Midnight to 6 AM = 6 hours. Total sleep = 3 + 6 = 9 hours.

questions.question_text: How many numbers are on a clock face?
questions.explanation_correct: A clock face has 12 numbers, from 1 to 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A standard analog clock has 12 numbers (1 through 12) on its face.

questions.question_text: Lunch at school is at 12:30. Is this AM or PM?
questions.explanation_correct: 12:30 lunch time is in the afternoon, so it is 12:30 PM.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lunch at school is in the afternoon, after noon. So 12:30 lunch = 12:30 PM.

questions.question_text: How many days are there in the month of May?
questions.explanation_correct: May has 31 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: May is one of the seven months with 31 days.

questions.question_text: A cricket match starts at 2:00 PM and lasts 3 hours. What time does it end?
questions.explanation_correct: 2:00 PM + 3 hours = 5:00 PM.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add 3 hours to 2:00 PM: 2 + 3 = 5:00 PM.

questions.question_text: If the minute hand moves from 12 to 3, how many minutes have passed?
questions.explanation_correct: From 12 to 3 on the clock face = 3 x 5 = 15 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each number represents 5 minutes. From 12 to 3 = 3 x 5 = 15 minutes.

questions.question_text: Which is the last month of the year?
questions.explanation_correct: December is the 12th and last month of the year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: December (month 12) is the last month. January starts the next year.

questions.question_text: Papa leaves for work at 9:00 AM and comes home at 6:00 PM. How many hours is he away?
questions.explanation_correct: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM = 9 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count: 9 AM to noon = 3 hours. Noon to 6 PM = 6 hours. Total = 9 hours.

questions.question_text: 5 o'clock is written as ___
questions.explanation_correct: 5 o'clock means 5 hours and 0 minutes, written as 5:00.
questions.explanation_incorrect: O'clock means the minute hand is at 12 (zero minutes). 5 o'clock = 5:00.

questions.question_text: If today is January 28, what will be the date after 5 days?
questions.explanation_correct: January has 31 days. Jan 28 + 5 = Jan 33, but Jan has only 31 days. So Jan 31 + 2 more = Feb 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Jan 28, 29, 30, 31, then Feb 1, Feb 2. Counting 5 days from Jan 28 gives Feb 2.

questions.question_text: An exam starts at 10:00 AM and lasts 1 hour 30 minutes. What time does it end?
questions.explanation_correct: 10:00 AM + 1 hour 30 minutes = 11:30 AM.

questions.question_text: True or False: The minute hand is shorter than the hour hand.
questions.explanation_correct: False. The minute hand (long hand) is LONGER than the hour hand (short hand).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The minute hand is the long hand and the hour hand is the short hand. So the minute hand is longer.

questions.question_text: Independence Day (15th August) falls in which month?
questions.explanation_correct: India's Independence Day is on 15th August.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Independence Day is celebrated on 15th August every year.

questions.question_text: Amma puts a cake in the oven at 3:15 PM. It needs to bake for 45 minutes. What time should she take it out?
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3:15 PM + 45 minutes = 4:00 PM (since 15 + 45 = 60 minutes = 1 hour).

questions.question_text: Which of these activities happens in the AM?
questions.explanation_correct: Brushing teeth in the morning happens in the AM (before noon).
questions.explanation_incorrect: AM is from midnight to noon. Morning activities like brushing teeth happen in the AM.

questions.question_text: How many weeks are approximately in one month?
questions.explanation_correct: Most months have about 4 weeks (28-31 days, and 4 weeks = 28 days).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A month has 28-31 days. 4 weeks = 28 days, so approximately 4 weeks in a month.

questions.question_text: At 6:00, where do the hour hand and minute hand point?

options.text: Hour hand at 6, minute hand at 12
Hour hand at 12, minute hand at 6

questions.explanation_correct: At 6:00, the hour hand points to 6 and the minute hand points to 12 (0 minutes).
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 6 o'clock: short hand (hour) at 6, long hand (minute) at 12.

questions.question_text: True or False: From 2:30 PM to 4:00 PM is 1 hour 30 minutes.
questions.explanation_correct: True. 2:30 to 3:00 = 30 min, 3:00 to 4:00 = 60 min. Total = 90 min = 1 hour 30 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 2:30 to 3:30 = 1 hour, then 3:30 to 4:00 = 30 more minutes. Total = 1 hour 30 minutes.

questions.question_text: Republic Day is on 26th January. Which day of the week it falls on changes every year. If this year it is on Thursday, what day was it last week?
questions.explanation_correct: One week before Thursday 26th January = Thursday 19th January (same day, 7 days back).
questions.explanation_incorrect: 7 days before Thursday is also a Thursday. 26 - 7 = 19. So it was Thursday 19th January.
